intro: Cissampelos clematidea, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, orange aril. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
